content:
Posted: April 12, 2014
												First the bad stuff:-EXPENSIVE game if you are gonna use euros to unlock dragons... you can unlock random dragons but you don't know if you will some of the old dragons you got (coming back to that later) or someone new to test.Also buying a single dragon costs just as much as buying 3 random ones and you get the first rank of the dragon... not the 3rd rank (something that is a really bad deal for what? 3-5 euro).-There are 3 diffrent ranks between the dragons that increases armor (or hp or whatever) and movement speed... something that means if you meet someone that you just as great against... and you got the first rank and he got the 2nd or 3rd rank of the same dragon... he will win because of his small stat gain... I do love the dragon ranks... but it would have been enough with just the graphical coolness of higher rank dragons... Removing stats on diffrent mastery ranks would be really smart...-The lore and the dialogs feels like are written by a 5 year old... some of the dialog is so bad and some of the missions feel so stupid that I some times started to wonder why I even tested this game at all...There are mobs in the act 1 missions that are so annoying... like some ghosts that are protecting some crypts you need to destroy... They all just fly towards you and push you out of position and you take damage without the monsters having any animation at all... almost like you thought it was made by an indie game company without any animators... or any interested programmers to actually make a decent mob script...-Every time you complete an act you get an dragon... The main problem with that is that the act is so long and the amount of gems (that you can use for unlocking more dragons) is so low... you rather feel like playing lol or any other type of moba game because you progress a lot faster in those games.. But, yeah you can also get mastery on the dragon by doing ALL the challanges on every mission in every act! That's 15 reruns of each of the missions you actually would'nt want to play in the first place! 15!!!!!!-there is no way to do practice games vs bots to try out dragons. I know it's a free rotation every week but yeah. If you want a player to waste 5 euro on one dragon you better let him have a taste of what he is gonna buy or else the player will find something else to waste his money on... and that won't be anything related to this game... unless he buys shyvanna from lol... because she is a dragon thingie... same with Ao in smite... or whatever that chinese dragon's name is...I felt that these things needed to be highlighted in the review because these are pretty annoying and game/mood breaking things that I have noticed so far in the game and it's the first impression a new player meet in this game.Good things about the game.-The movement system is quite functional. easy to move around and holding space makes you fly backwards while you can use your skills in the direction you are pointing... It may give a good feeling in pvp.-Game looks ok/good graphical. Of course there could be some major improvements in the graphics... but I liked it...-There are tons of interesting and cool looking dragons... gives you the interest of wanting to try everyone of them... To bad there is'nt a 20 dragon bundle pack of rank 2 dragons or whatever...-The way you get to chose your two first skills by the dragon type and the two other remaining skills by chosing items is actually really well done. I liked it a lot... To bad I will use my time playing smite instead untill they manage to do some major changes in how their greedy minds works...-I am pretty certain that if you play this game for a month or two... all the negative things I wrote won't really be an issue as you will have unlocked a few dragons just by gems and dices that the game will be worthwhile to game full time. That and the horrible campaign will be long gone memories that you would never have to touch with your mind ever the f... again....

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												Love this game! Awesome dragons, awesome weapons. My one and only complaint is that there is no way to buy the dragon or weapon or skin or avatar, etc you want. You either have to grind out 5000 gems and buy three random dragons, or do the daily reward. And even then, you're only getting dragons. There is no way to buy avatars or skins except by the Titan Pass. I don't like the Titan Pass because it takes the fun out of playing and grinding to get new stuff. I like having to earn gems to buy dragons, I just wish I could get more than just dragons and weapons and runes with the gems I earn. Even if the avatars and skins were like 10,000 gems or more then at least I could earn them myself. A good idea for the people making money on this game: Let people choose between grinding out a lot of gems to get the skins or avatars or buy them for real money. OR They can buy a specific skin or avatar with real money AND hold events every now and again to win a free or reduced price avatar or skin. There just needs to be some way that players can get one specific thing in game they want. The Titan Pass takes the fun out of the game because it unlocks everything and leaves nothing but the gameplay, which is totally fun don't get me wrong, but part of the fun is grinding to unlock things bit by bit. It gives players a sense of accomplishment to unlock things themselves. I have read through a good portion of the reviews and like 90 somthing % of them that like this game, complain about the Titan Pass so I am not alone in this and you might want to change it so that your number of players increases. People will pay $5 for an in game dragon. They are unlikely to pay $20 for every dragon. Yes, there are exceptions because it is a good deal if you look at what you're getting for $20, but for the rest of us, we're looking at the fact that you're taking away the fun of unlocking things. Forgive the repetitiveness and lengthiness of this review and I really hope those in charge of how this game works will take my ideas into consideration.

content:
Posted: December 12, 2016
												/!\ the mentionned bugs were fixed within a day ! Please keep this in mind while reading ! /!\I did not play a lot, I do not hide it. Yet I feel like I have played enough to give my impressions on this game.What I noticed first was graphical issues. Some textures seem to me missing whatever quality / resolution I am using. Maybe this will be fixed later, maybe this did not happen to other people, but on my side it does. This isn't game breaking but it did not gave me a good feeling at first, I'm afraid.Looking at the different solo missions available, it is quite obvious that dragons and titans is about playing it again, again, and again. Playing a few memorable missions is something I would like to do, but, please, don't make us play 15 times the 10 missions of every act. This does not make me want to keep going. Sure, there are rewards awaiting you if you are patient enough to accomplish this, but I don't feel like it is worth it.The controls are pretty okay to me. Right click to move, left click to attack. It has auto aiming so you can move around and attempt dodging fireballs and stuff while breathing stuff at others. Every playable character has its regular attack, different from the others, and its active skill. You can equip a weapon to gain two more active skills. Gold isn't used to buy stuff but when returning it to your team's horde you get experience points.  I liked things being this way : simple, allowing you to play right off the bat without wasting your time setting up the perfect build.I'm coming back to the farming / grinding thing : everything can be bought at once with the titan pass as well as the next year's new weapons and mounts (I have no idea is this is still worth it from now on... I don't know how fast things are being added) or one by one with real money. And, god, this is expensive if you don't take the titan pass. Or you can grind, and grind, and grind to get enough gems (the in-game currency) to buy a pack of three mounts that can be mounts you already possess ! You apparently can upgrade them if you have x times the same tier of a mount's type but I still did not went to this point.There is an annoying "bug" where there is an "attention" pop-up seemingly wanting to tell me something... But it is empty and there is no way to get rid of it, forcing me to quit and relaunch the game. This is pretty annoying when this always happens after around 20, 25 minutes of gameplay.To sum it up : a pretty easy MOBA to get in with little work to put in builds. If you want to get new stuff, buy it or grind a lot. Since it's free to play, giving it a try will not hurt anyone. I just hope you won't get the few annoying things I got while playing.I am recommending this to people who know nothing about MOBAs and would like to know the very basics of what it is. I find LoL and Dota2 quite harder to get at first so this game might be a good start.Cheers !

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 16, 2014
												I believe this will be the first review written by someone who has more than a few menial hours invested in the game. I've played a season and a half, last season I was ranked somewhere in the top 50. To begin with, this game has epic potential, I discovered it by chance via fb apps and after many hours and a terrible kdr (kill death ratio) , I grew to love it. The mechanics, the community and the competitive spirit. Making my way up the ranks I watched in awe at how good the pro players were and worked at getting a decent, well thought out rune set and understand the strengths and weaknesses of the multitude of dragons and weapons available. The negative reviews here were likely written by people who failed to grasp, that this, like most moba's, has a learning curve and that you need to adapt to get any joy from the game. How many of us kicked off Dota2 or LoL and mastered controls and gameplay immediately? Last season the game suffered immense balance issues with the release of a terribly OP'd dragon and weapon. This was fixed, somewhat at the start of season 4 and a great many dragons were improved.You may at this point ask yourself why I don't recommend the game. The truth is, I don't recommend it for anyone who enjoys a competitive moba experience, I don't recommend it for anyone who enjoys a challenge. Those aspects no longer exist in the DnT universe thanks to the fantastic work the devs did with the controls.The game now gives you the option of using "legacy" controls, that don't provide auto-aim or strafing and the new controls which do. They claim it's to make the game easier and even out the playing field. They believe this ease of play will attract new players. It isn't and I doubt it will. What it has caused is the current boycott of pvp matches and micro-transactions. if you have a look at their fb page you'll be greeted with tons of negative comments from the once loyal community, including those who stuck with this game since open beta. To summarize, pvp is a mess, stay away from it.Get This Game IF:You enjoy ease of play akin to the My Little Pony collection.You have no interest in moba or pvp.You own the directors cut of Eragon.You're bored out of your mind and you'd like to login on days like this to read the excellent lore.Avoid like a Justin Bieber concert If:You love a challenge.You have better things to do, like watching paint dry.Have an interest in Esports.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												If you are planning to try this game or thinking of getting Titan Pass, please read the following. Also notice the number of game hours I have (~960 hours).  This game is very badly broken. There are far too many OP combos that can not be played against. You will receive assurances that they are being fixed but they haven't been for 3 seasons at least. Some examples of OP unplayable combos: 50% of available dragons + Truth's charge (Any map) Venomtail + Sparrowthorn (Any map) Venomtail + Winterfloe (Any map) Rimrock + Sparrowthorn (Any map) Lunaveil + Sphere of wudeng (Ballistae Alley, but OP on any map) Goldenclaw + chillblade (Any map) Magmascale + chillblade (Chaos Unleashed / MOBA, but OP on any map) Autobot + chillblade (Chaos Unleashed / MOBA) Swiftwing + Unity mark (Chaos Unleashed / MOBA) DarkOne + chill blade (Any map) Dreadnaught + Rodar (Ballistae Alley) Gravelurker + Truth's charge (Nether gate)So skill really makes no difference in this game. Use any of the above combos to get lots of kills. Kills translate to higher ranking and more crystals, so you can buy more dragons. You can combine dragons to make more powerful dragons so you can get more kills, so continues the cycle. Some of you reading below will say I am a bad player complaining because I don not have the dragons listed below. Trust me, I have 10+ highest level (T4) dragons including 5 of the OP combos mentioned below. As a principle I refuse to use OP combos. So most of the time I am either getting killed or just defending against OP combos (using a defensive combo - see below). As I mentioned, the above weapon combos are unplayable against, which means you have a 90% chance of losing against them. Only way to counter the Truth's charge weapon is to use the Chillblade weapon. So you will see lots of 'so called pros' running around with those combos. The only other way you can keep yourself from being killed every 1-2 minutes is to use a Tanglewing dragon + Rainmaker combo (my defensive combo). The moderators and devs do not care about fixing the game and in fact are the people who use the OP combos. So if you are a new player, you are only helping them increase their ranking. What can you say about people whos only sense of importance is getting higher ranking using an OP combo on an online game... ;-) This game allows duos (where two players can play together on same team). This just makes a broken game even more impossible to win. So two already good players will duo with OP combos making the odds of winning impossible. So you can bring complementary combos (e.g. two combos that almost slow enemy to a halt, combos that give unlimited health + mana, etc) So by the end of the game you will see they have killed like 15+ times each. I have rarely seen mods on here who are sensible. The only qualification for being a mod on this game is to support the game no matter how broken it is and to of course prove it is not broken by using an OP combo. So that entails using the OP combo to show its broken and of course to keep telling players that nerfs and balances are coming. Trust me, they are not. 3 seasons ago, the DarkOne + Truth's charge was OP and we were told it was nerfed. Guess what, it still is OP and impossible to play against. The game has 5 vs 5 PVP games mostly where you can use a preselected dragon + weapon combo. However it is so badly broken that it allows more than one player to use the same combo. So it is not unusual to see all 5 players using the same dragon or combo. So you will see games where you opposite team has 5 Dreadnaughts + Rodar's sceptre combo. That dragon is basically has the highest health and one of the highest damages in this game and can heal other dragons. Rodar's sceptre weapon increases your dragon's damage. So you know playing that game has like a 0.001% chance of winning. Hell, even if you have two Dreadnaughts in your team or enemy team the game becomes unbalanced since the 2 of those dragons will just outheal any damage you take or inflict. Unlike other games, you can not pick what dragons or weapons you want to buy. 5000 in game crystals get you 3 random dragons out of 30+ possible dragons. 2500 crystals get you 3 random weapons out of 25+ possible weasopns. You do not know what dragon you will get and if you get duplicates you are stuck with them. You can sell or use duplicate dragons to create higher level dragons, but given most dragons except the OP ones are useless, you are just wasting your time. So you can grind for hours and let yourself be killed hundreds of times by OP combos in the hope that you can get enough crystals to get better dragons. But after all that effort, you do not control which dragon or weapon u get. Despite all the above, if you still want to go ahead and try the game, my advice is that you try it for free. Do not waste any of your money on Titan's pass. Yes, they will say you get 4 times more crystals per game. Yes, they will say you will get access to all dragons and weapons but you already know you only ever need one of the 2 OP weapons and one of the above mentioned OP dragons. Better yet, keep making multiple accounts to get dragons + weapons. Since each new account gets 3 free dragons and weapons, you might get lucky with an account and get one of the OP combos above. The when u want to use that OP combo switch to that account to play, then create another account to try and get another OP combo... :-)I hope this review helps you understand what you are getting into for this game and what you will get in return for your money. My advice is simple - do not invest your money or time in this game. Try any of the other games that this game tried to copy very badly - Leage of Legends, DOTA2, plenty others... At least there you will supporting a community that really cares.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 12, 2014
												Okay, so I've been playing this game for a while and here is what I have to say.It's pretty damn good, the visuals are nice, the various dragons keep matches interesting and I can assure you, you'll have a hard time finding only one you like.A lot of people tend to compare this to something like League of Legends, or DOTA. I honestly don't understand that comparison, I've seen LoL and I've played DOTA. And while all three games are MOBA, they're all unique in their own way. So with that out of the way, let's get onto the pros and cons of this game...Pros-VarietyOh yes, there is quite a selection to choose from, with lots of dragons and weapons the choose from. Each mixing together in their own way. Some for better, some for worse.-CommunityThe community for this game is usually rather friendly and welcoming, I believe a major factor to this is the smaller player base in comparison to something like DOTA.-OriginalityAlthough the game is rather standard when it comes to MOBA maps and gameplay, they aesthetics stand out from the rest. While most MOBAs have you going toe to toe in some sort of arena, forest, etc. This game takes it up a notch, you're flying on the back of these magnificent beasts high in the sky, fighting on various planes to free your Titan as the battle between light and dark wages on.-StoryBesides the "Lore" tab on all of the weapons and dragons, the game also has a single player story mode, something I've never seen in this kind of game before. In which various events call upon you to help. Whether it's bringing the Myre Bog back to peace, or fighting through Magekeep in a desperate struggle for power. Most of the story is rather interesting, albeit with some problems.-ForgingAnother thing I find rather unique to this game. You will get various gemstones throughout your playtime, those are used in the Forge to buff your weapons, giving it various perks such as shortening the cooldown for abilities, the mana cost of some abilities, or even just a flat out increase of damage.Cons-MapsThe maps are your typical MOBA style maps, although usually with some sort of twist. The problem being there's only four maps as this is being written. Chaos Unleashed, Baliste Alley, Nethergate and Towers and Titans. It's a shame, alongside the fact all multiplayer matches use the same map. The maps rotate on a vote system every thirty (30) minutes.-The PlayerbaseDon't get me wrong, the community is lovely, and most have a really good attitude. But the issue is how small it is, as it can lead to long queue times. Other than that there's not much to complain.So in conclusion, Dragons and Titans is nice little MOBA with new aspects to it, while still keeping it familar to fans of the genre. And if you like it, a Titan Pass is only 20 USD a month for a year's worth of content.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 12, 2016
												/!\ the mentionned bugs were fixed within a day ! Please keep this in mind while reading ! /!\I did not play a lot, I do not hide it. Yet I feel like I have played enough to give my impressions on this game.What I noticed first was graphical issues. Some textures seem to me missing whatever quality / resolution I am using. Maybe this will be fixed later, maybe this did not happen to other people, but on my side it does. This isn't game breaking but it did not gave me a good feeling at first, I'm afraid.Looking at the different solo missions available, it is quite obvious that dragons and titans is about playing it again, again, and again. Playing a few memorable missions is something I would like to do, but, please, don't make us play 15 times the 10 missions of every act. This does not make me want to keep going. Sure, there are rewards awaiting you if you are patient enough to accomplish this, but I don't feel like it is worth it.The controls are pretty okay to me. Right click to move, left click to attack. It has auto aiming so you can move around and attempt dodging fireballs and stuff while breathing stuff at others. Every playable character has its regular attack, different from the others, and its active skill. You can equip a weapon to gain two more active skills. Gold isn't used to buy stuff but when returning it to your team's horde you get experience points.  I liked things being this way : simple, allowing you to play right off the bat without wasting your time setting up the perfect build.I'm coming back to the farming / grinding thing : everything can be bought at once with the titan pass as well as the next year's new weapons and mounts (I have no idea is this is still worth it from now on... I don't know how fast things are being added) or one by one with real money. And, god, this is expensive if you don't take the titan pass. Or you can grind, and grind, and grind to get enough gems (the in-game currency) to buy a pack of three mounts that can be mounts you already possess ! You apparently can upgrade them if you have x times the same tier of a mount's type but I still did not went to this point.There is an annoying "bug" where there is an "attention" pop-up seemingly wanting to tell me something... But it is empty and there is no way to get rid of it, forcing me to quit and relaunch the game. This is pretty annoying when this always happens after around 20, 25 minutes of gameplay.To sum it up : a pretty easy MOBA to get in with little work to put in builds. If you want to get new stuff, buy it or grind a lot. Since it's free to play, giving it a try will not hurt anyone. I just hope you won't get the few annoying things I got while playing.I am recommending this to people who know nothing about MOBAs and would like to know the very basics of what it is. I find LoL and Dota2 quite harder to get at first so this game might be a good start.Cheers !

content:
Posted: May 3, 2015
												A good concept ruined by poor execution. All dragons, while unique in appearance are all very similiar. Each dragon only has two attacks, and almost all of them have a standard breath attack. So really dragons only have one attack that is different from another dragon. The way they tried to fix this, was with weapons. Equipping a weapon will give your dragon two more attacks depending on the weapon you equipped. The problem is, this doesn't make things more unique, it makes them more stale. Say you and another dragon have the same weapon equipped. Well now you and that dragon only have one unique move between each other, and he's a completely different dragon. This is made even worse by the fact that there is no item shop in game. Dragons scale with levels, thats it. So while you might do good damage to an enemy DPS, theres nothing you can do to help you damage against a Tank, or if you need more HP to survive, theres no way to get it.Speaking of "no way to get it", thats what I have to tell you bout a dragon you might want to buy. You see, you don't just buy the one you want, oh no, you have to get lucky and play whats basically a slot machine and hope you get lucky. Oh you got the one you want you say? Well guess what, dragons actually have different levels outside of the game that make them stronger. So while you may have gotten that awesome Gemtalon I, he's nowhere near as strong or awesome as Gemtalon III.Its a watered down moba, aiming to cash in on the popularity of dragons by locking them all behind a slot machine and hoping you spend a bunch of money to get one, before you realize the game isn't deep enough to warrant spending money.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 16, 2014
												I believe this will be the first review written by someone who has more than a few menial hours invested in the game. I've played a season and a half, last season I was ranked somewhere in the top 50. To begin with, this game has epic potential, I discovered it by chance via fb apps and after many hours and a terrible kdr (kill death ratio) , I grew to love it. The mechanics, the community and the competitive spirit. Making my way up the ranks I watched in awe at how good the pro players were and worked at getting a decent, well thought out rune set and understand the strengths and weaknesses of the multitude of dragons and weapons available. The negative reviews here were likely written by people who failed to grasp, that this, like most moba's, has a learning curve and that you need to adapt to get any joy from the game. How many of us kicked off Dota2 or LoL and mastered controls and gameplay immediately? Last season the game suffered immense balance issues with the release of a terribly OP'd dragon and weapon. This was fixed, somewhat at the start of season 4 and a great many dragons were improved.You may at this point ask yourself why I don't recommend the game. The truth is, I don't recommend it for anyone who enjoys a competitive moba experience, I don't recommend it for anyone who enjoys a challenge. Those aspects no longer exist in the DnT universe thanks to the fantastic work the devs did with the controls.The game now gives you the option of using "legacy" controls, that don't provide auto-aim or strafing and the new controls which do. They claim it's to make the game easier and even out the playing field. They believe this ease of play will attract new players. It isn't and I doubt it will. What it has caused is the current boycott of pvp matches and micro-transactions. if you have a look at their fb page you'll be greeted with tons of negative comments from the once loyal community, including those who stuck with this game since open beta. To summarize, pvp is a mess, stay away from it.Get This Game IF:You enjoy ease of play akin to the My Little Pony collection.You have no interest in moba or pvp.You own the directors cut of Eragon.You're bored out of your mind and you'd like to login on days like this to read the excellent lore.Avoid like a Justin Bieber concert If:You love a challenge.You have better things to do, like watching paint dry.Have an interest in Esports.

												Okay, so I've been playing this game for a while and here is what I have to say.It's pretty damn good, the visuals are nice, the various dragons keep matches interesting and I can assure you, you'll have a hard time finding only one you like.A lot of people tend to compare this to something like League of Legends, or DOTA. I honestly don't understand that comparison, I've seen LoL and I've played DOTA. And while all three games are MOBA, they're all unique in their own way. So with that out of the way, let's get onto the pros and cons of this game...Pros-VarietyOh yes, there is quite a selection to choose from, with lots of dragons and weapons the choose from. Each mixing together in their own way. Some for better, some for worse.-CommunityThe community for this game is usually rather friendly and welcoming, I believe a major factor to this is the smaller player base in comparison to something like DOTA.-OriginalityAlthough the game is rather standard when it comes to MOBA maps and gameplay, they aesthetics stand out from the rest. While most MOBAs have you going toe to toe in some sort of arena, forest, etc. This game takes it up a notch, you're flying on the back of these magnificent beasts high in the sky, fighting on various planes to free your Titan as the battle between light and dark wages on.-StoryBesides the "Lore" tab on all of the weapons and dragons, the game also has a single player story mode, something I've never seen in this kind of game before. In which various events call upon you to help. Whether it's bringing the Myre Bog back to peace, or fighting through Magekeep in a desperate struggle for power. Most of the story is rather interesting, albeit with some problems.-ForgingAnother thing I find rather unique to this game. You will get various gemstones throughout your playtime, those are used in the Forge to buff your weapons, giving it various perks such as shortening the cooldown for abilities, the mana cost of some abilities, or even just a flat out increase of damage.Cons-MapsThe maps are your typical MOBA style maps, although usually with some sort of twist. The problem being there's only four maps as this is being written. Chaos Unleashed, Baliste Alley, Nethergate and Towers and Titans. It's a shame, alongside the fact all multiplayer matches use the same map. The maps rotate on a vote system every thirty (30) minutes.-The PlayerbaseDon't get me wrong, the community is lovely, and most have a really good attitude. But the issue is how small it is, as it can lead to long queue times. Other than that there's not much to complain.So in conclusion, Dragons and Titans is nice little MOBA with new aspects to it, while still keeping it familar to fans of the genre. And if you like it, a Titan Pass is only 20 USD a month for a year's worth of content.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												If you are planning to try this game or thinking of getting Titan Pass, please read the following. Also notice the number of game hours I have (~960 hours).  This game is very badly broken. There are far too many OP combos that can not be played against. You will receive assurances that they are being fixed but they haven't been for 3 seasons at least. Some examples of OP unplayable combos: 50% of available dragons + Truth's charge (Any map) Venomtail + Sparrowthorn (Any map) Venomtail + Winterfloe (Any map) Rimrock + Sparrowthorn (Any map) Lunaveil + Sphere of wudeng (Ballistae Alley, but OP on any map) Goldenclaw + chillblade (Any map) Magmascale + chillblade (Chaos Unleashed / MOBA, but OP on any map) Autobot + chillblade (Chaos Unleashed / MOBA) Swiftwing + Unity mark (Chaos Unleashed / MOBA) DarkOne + chill blade (Any map) Dreadnaught + Rodar (Ballistae Alley) Gravelurker + Truth's charge (Nether gate)So skill really makes no difference in this game. Use any of the above combos to get lots of kills. Kills translate to higher ranking and more crystals, so you can buy more dragons. You can combine dragons to make more powerful dragons so you can get more kills, so continues the cycle. Some of you reading below will say I am a bad player complaining because I don not have the dragons listed below. Trust me, I have 10+ highest level (T4) dragons including 5 of the OP combos mentioned below. As a principle I refuse to use OP combos. So most of the time I am either getting killed or just defending against OP combos (using a defensive combo - see below). As I mentioned, the above weapon combos are unplayable against, which means you have a 90% chance of losing against them. Only way to counter the Truth's charge weapon is to use the Chillblade weapon. So you will see lots of 'so called pros' running around with those combos. The only other way you can keep yourself from being killed every 1-2 minutes is to use a Tanglewing dragon + Rainmaker combo (my defensive combo). The moderators and devs do not care about fixing the game and in fact are the people who use the OP combos. So if you are a new player, you are only helping them increase their ranking. What can you say about people whos only sense of importance is getting higher ranking using an OP combo on an online game... ;-) This game allows duos (where two players can play together on same team). This just makes a broken game even more impossible to win. So two already good players will duo with OP combos making the odds of winning impossible. So you can bring complementary combos (e.g. two combos that almost slow enemy to a halt, combos that give unlimited health + mana, etc) So by the end of the game you will see they have killed like 15+ times each. I have rarely seen mods on here who are sensible. The only qualification for being a mod on this game is to support the game no matter how broken it is and to of course prove it is not broken by using an OP combo. So that entails using the OP combo to show its broken and of course to keep telling players that nerfs and balances are coming. Trust me, they are not. 3 seasons ago, the DarkOne + Truth's charge was OP and we were told it was nerfed. Guess what, it still is OP and impossible to play against. The game has 5 vs 5 PVP games mostly where you can use a preselected dragon + weapon combo. However it is so badly broken that it allows more than one player to use the same combo. So it is not unusual to see all 5 players using the same dragon or combo. So you will see games where you opposite team has 5 Dreadnaughts + Rodar's sceptre combo. That dragon is basically has the highest health and one of the highest damages in this game and can heal other dragons. Rodar's sceptre weapon increases your dragon's damage. So you know playing that game has like a 0.001% chance of winning. Hell, even if you have two Dreadnaughts in your team or enemy team the game becomes unbalanced since the 2 of those dragons will just outheal any damage you take or inflict. Unlike other games, you can not pick what dragons or weapons you want to buy. 5000 in game crystals get you 3 random dragons out of 30+ possible dragons. 2500 crystals get you 3 random weapons out of 25+ possible weasopns. You do not know what dragon you will get and if you get duplicates you are stuck with them. You can sell or use duplicate dragons to create higher level dragons, but given most dragons except the OP ones are useless, you are just wasting your time. So you can grind for hours and let yourself be killed hundreds of times by OP combos in the hope that you can get enough crystals to get better dragons. But after all that effort, you do not control which dragon or weapon u get. Despite all the above, if you still want to go ahead and try the game, my advice is that you try it for free. Do not waste any of your money on Titan's pass. Yes, they will say you get 4 times more crystals per game. Yes, they will say you will get access to all dragons and weapons but you already know you only ever need one of the 2 OP weapons and one of the above mentioned OP dragons. Better yet, keep making multiple accounts to get dragons + weapons. Since each new account gets 3 free dragons and weapons, you might get lucky with an account and get one of the OP combos above. The when u want to use that OP combo switch to that account to play, then create another account to try and get another OP combo... :-)I hope this review helps you understand what you are getting into for this game and what you will get in return for your money. My advice is simple - do not invest your money or time in this game. Try any of the other games that this game tried to copy very badly - Leage of Legends, DOTA2, plenty others... At least there you will supporting a community that really cares.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2016
												this game would be awesome IF it wasn't for it needing soo many tweaks and fixes.  First of all is the targeting.  you virtually have no control over it.  sure you can hit the space bar to select the closest one to you, but too many times a bird would fly by and the dragon would act like the dogs from teh movie "Up" when they saw a squirle and immediately auto target the bird.  This is the game breaker for me. Too many times have i had a definate kill then all of a sudden a bird would fly by and my targeting would jsut switch and let teh enemy dragon get away.Second, there are alot of balacing/Tech issues with the game.  The Server lags tremendously. too many times do you hit a skill button and it does nothing, in match making it puts you in with other players that are way higher developed than you.  For Example, when the more you play a particular weapon or dragon, the higher rank you get with it. it goes through the typic progression of no rank -> bronze -> silver -> gold -> diamond.  when you rank your dragon up it moves faster and gets more health and the weapons get shorter cool downs on the skills it gives you.  this is a huge advantage in games as either they can jsut out run you and get away or chase you down with you having no hope of escaping.Thrid, is how oyu upgrade your dragons.  they go from I - IV and they get bonuses each time they upgrade.  you upgrade by getting 3 of a particular rank. you get dragons either by random chance by using crystals or you can buy the rank 1 for 2.99.  if you have a dragon you really like and want to get it to rank IV you either have to get really luckky with the random eggs OR you can by it for 81$ US.  Also as you lvl up you can start using Runes and to get runes you have to buy them with either crystals or using real money and even if you use real money the runes you get are totally random.  this is basically a pay to win game and if I am going to use real money i want a definate choice on what I spend my money on, not a random chance.Lastly is the game type selection.  Instead of letting you choose the game type you want to play, the map is voted on and then for the next 30 min you HAVE to play that map.This game is a huge let down because it has to the potential to be a great game, not only on the PC but console platforms too.  The game play is fun, but incredibly fustrating with all the issues it has that I mentioned above.  If they made the tweaks/Fixes to the issues i stated above I would definately recommend this game, but as it stands now I can NOT in good conscience recommend this game.

												It's a nice game, I guess, although at times it can seriously seem like an iPad app or something. If you don't get the dragon or weapon you want, then oh well, you'll have to go spend some money on it. Quite literally you have to pay for almost everything in the game. After beating the first long string of levels and unlocking the Noxwing, you have to pay some money to unlock the nest stupid long string of levels. It's also annoying that you have to rebuild your perks back up every single time you start a new level. Seriously, I play one level and max out my perks, then go to the next level and they're all gone again and I get slaughtered in about five seconds because of that. It also has numerous glitches that make it so you have to restart whatever level or challenge you're trying to do.

number of helpful: 4 of 10 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 13, 2014
												Too similar to other slow-paced mobas, this game only removes the floor from the levels and adds clunkiness to controls which doesn't make you feel like you're flying at all. Once I finished the entirely-too-patronizing handholder of a tutorial, and the main event tutorials, and saw my random selection of dragons and weapons, I knew the limitted vision of the creators wasn't going to keep me interested in this game. Bear in mind these are five-dollar dragons each. I got a dragon...made of wood. Then one...made of swords. The wood one, it blew THORNS like a reed pipe *toot toot toot* which brings me to the shallow sound design. Granted, it's a moba and isometric, but it'd be nice if the attacks, (since you only ever have four,) ought to be somewhat impacting or 'effective' sounding. The fire breathing sounds like a 10th-of-a-second loop of generic fireplace rumble. People say the screenshots don't reflect the game accurately, but I disagree, it's the angle of perspective from which they're taken that makes the game appear far more immersive than it actually is. The screenies look like they were shot from a TPS or at least quarter-down perspective, but in the main game this view isn't often available...the usual top-down affair is the mainstay. Click the screenies to view them in their full resolution and know, that's the BEST this game can look, from its most complimenting angle. All in all, have to recommend against this title, with so many more open and less expensive to enjoy mobas proliferating Steam these days. Just because this has dragons...doesn't make it worth playing. That's -all- it has. They aren't terribly attractive/compelling dragons anyways.

												I've played almost every MOBA and LoL and DotA 2 are by far the best. These games are just poorly made duplicates, with terrible encentives like Dragons and Titans. "WOW!" It has dragons (really cool bc dragons are beast) and titans (theyre also really cool divine people) and yeah sounds cool. Actually, does it  sound cool or is it just lame? The gameplay is filthy, it is also a bit P2W. There also isnt much strategy at all. Ill list them.- NO ♥♥♥♥ING ITEMS!!!!!! I mean, what the actual ♥♥♥♥.- 4 spells on each dragon, and about 15 dragons maybe. However, the Q is always a normal attack, usually fire breath. Sometimes a beam of light or something. So. really u have 3 spells now. they also have no strategy, normally theyre all dmg spells and basically all you do is spam them all on the enemy and hope for a kill. - Also, if you are a good player, and get fed heaps, it still wont mean that u can just fly around the map and burn everyone in 1 second. No, instead you are still weak as p!ss beacuse of the fact THAT THERE ARE NO ITEMS!!!!Basically, the game is absolute sh!t

content:
Posted: March 18, 2014
												7/10I haven't played it very much yet, but I feel I can say it's a game I would recommend playing, and it's only 500MB. It might not be a big game like LoL or DotA, but I've enjoyed it. Yes, it didn't exploit the idea's potential, but it's a good game. The graphics aren't very good, but they aren't that important - though the level design looks very good to me.Some of the other reviews said that this is a pay to win, and I would say it definitely isn't. Yes, you have to play quite a lot to unlock new dragons - and this may be the only true downside I've found in this game - but you can get everything obtainable without throwing real money in it.For the gameplay, I must say it was pretty entartaining, though it wasn't too funny, but I guess it would be really nice to play with a bunch of friends while talking via voice chat.

content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
												Hoard + Dota in a fun way :)No in-match items: Hoard all gold for a titan spawn and for a personal xp, and feel no pain as newcomer. You only have to pick a weapon for your dragon at picking phase, which is not very complicated.No counter-pick playing: You won't see enemy team until match start. Good for newcomers too.Not exactly pay2win: You can buy unlocks, but you also can earn them for playing in any game mode.So it's an easy-to-start game, not like most MOBA games.But remember: stick to a team from a start!Also, DRAGONS!

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												Great concept but terrible execution. Game is unbalanced as hell, and bug ridden. Every update introduce new unbalanced items and new bugs. Old bugs drag on for years and the devs pay little attention to the quality. The game started on a good concept but was ruined by the developers due to ignorance and incompetence.There were 3 maps in the game, 2 of which were rubbish and nobody used to play maps other than the chaos/moba map. Instead of improving the other maps, they would force players to play random maps so the un-performing maps would be played. In addition, the 3 maps play differently, and the dragon/weapon selection would perform very differently depending on the map. This means no matter how much effort you put into this game, the outcome of a match is randomized, depending on which map it puts you into. This gives you an idea of the kind of people they are.The dragon and weapon selection is made before entering a game, and before you see any of your teammates or their selections. This means the player cannot choose combos that compliment the teammates. For a moba game this is horrible as players can never find a balanced team. Getting into a game with all support units against all attackers means a waste of 5-20 minutes of time.The game had a skill shot pvp system where players had to aim their shots. To dumb it down in a failed attempt to attract players, it was chcanged to auto-aim. So instead of maneuvering and finding an opening to shoot the opponent, players now hold down the mouse button and sit idle until someone dies or escapes. The weapons/dragons that are harder to hit but hits harder, are now auto-aimed just like the easier to hit pee shooters. They were left un-balanced after auto aim was implemented 1-2 years ago. Very little attention was paid to balance the gameplay, as a matter of fact, that there are only about a quarter of the dragons/weapons that provide competitive performance. The rest create useless combos that cause teammates to hate you.The game is plagued with hackers and lag bugs. Hackers would speed hack to win. They are reported by various over a year and no action would be taken. As a matter of fact, we would write support/report emails and would not hear answers for months, or ever in most cases. The lag bugs cause problem in gameplay where players take damage from the position they were in 1-2 seconds ago. Thus from your own computer, you'd think you are out of fire range but would still be taking damage. Furthermore, players are harmed by all kinds of invisble fireball, dragon breath that the server decided not to display.It is not bad to try out the game to taste the concept of a lighter version of moba. But the game is far from good and the devs are less than competent to bring it up to standard.

												A nice F2P game, works like LoL, DOTA etc. With diffrent gamemodes.You can earn ingame premium currency easy, this takes a while but that's to be expected.You level up your "profile" and unlocks shops at the world map to upgrade yourself with weapons and runes etc.After doing the tutorial its just to jump in and play, even though the tutorial could use a remake since it dont cover everything.There are a lot of dragons to be gained and if you find one you like it rewards to play with it a lot since you gain mastery levels in both your dragon and your weapons that make them a little stronger.Try it out and see for yourself.

number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2014
												This game is fun and interesting, though it does tend to have a bit of a steep learning curve. The previous problem of it being pay to win seems to be largely fixed, since there is nothing other than cosmetic items that can't be obtained through simple hard work and chance. Even so, even with only three dragons, I'm finding that the game is still fun and has yet to lose any of its playability. The list of different dragons and weapons is long, and each combination makes the experience unique. No dragon seems to be better than another, as each one has its own individual characteristics, and thereforesome are better for certain roles than others.I recommend the game, and think it genuinely is fun. The developers do seem to listen to the players, and have adjusted the game to not have any exclusivity. Dragons and Titans obviously is not at the level of such games as League and Dota, so it should not be compared to them. However, as far as mobas go, it's a pretty great game to play. At the very least, you should give it a try.

number of helpful: 4 of 11 people (36%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 14, 2014
												Ok whre to start. This Game is quite different from the usual Dotalike games. Its faster and round are shorter with usally more kills.The movement system is one of the biggest differences. There is no klick to move to location. Instead the dragon moves forward by either pressing shift or right mouse button. And it is always facing the mouse coursor. Space is used to move the dragon backwarts. There is no sideways movement.Most skills are skillshot fiering in a specific pattern from your dragon. For example dragon btreah usally fires out of the fron (duh) It less complex than other titles because it doesnt have items to buy in a match as you collect gold. Instead your skills will be determined by dragon and weapon choice for a total of 4 skills (two from each) and 2 additional spells like it it done in lol. There is a huge selection of Dragons (about 30) and weapons (about the same amount) all of which play somewhat differently. You get 3 random dragons and weapons permanently as part of the tutorial. Other than that you have the usual rotation of free dragons and weapons.The forced tutorial is one of the worst parts of the games. You have to go through serveral singleplayer mission + one match against the AI (a quite short one, just explaining the dota like mechanics) if you want to have full access to the multiplayer part. This should take about 45 minutes of gameplay and could be a letdown for some people.The game is somewhat pay to win. You can pay for dragons  and weapons(randoms or specific ones) and only radom weapons ad dragons can be bought in ingame currency. Dragons can be upgraded by using 3 Tier1  or tier 2 dragons of the same type. They get some slight bonuses for it. Like 8% less mana cost and 4% more speed. Something about that line. It is achiveable by just playing but it will take quite a long time and you have to be lucky to get the right random dragons. Buying a tier 3 dragon costs about. 45€There is a forging system which make weapons a bit stronger (something like 5% more damage, less cooldown, less mana cost) which can be payed for to get it as lot quicker.And there is a rune system. which you can buy runes for with real money. (only random) Of couse tier2 and tier3 runes are available for non paying players too but they take a long times to craft it seems. (about 3 days for one tier 3 rune and one day for a tier 2 rune). Sadly i cannot asses how strong tier 3 runes are in comparison to tier 2 and 1. Here could be the part where the real pay to win could lie.In total i would reccoment the game though. Its free and has dragons and it seems quite balanced and knowing the game is more important than bought 20% performance. You have to endure the tutorial though. Which isnt actually that bad.

Its free and has dragons and it seems quite balanced and knowing the game is more important than bought 20% performance. You have to endure the tutorial though. Which isnt actually that bad.

content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
												Dragons and Titans is a fun "action" MOBA, it offers alot of dragons to play as and a good amount of equipment to use, and best of all its pretty simple. I feel that the game is pretty far from a competitive game though, as hard as it is to believe it feels like an "all in good fun" MOBA. If you are looking for something thats MOBA like but not all the way through you should at least try Dragons and Titans, its not as bad as you might think.

Giv it a try see if you like it

												This game is pretty fun! Flying around as a dragon is awesome. The story line gets a little slow and repetitive, but the PVP is awesome! Leveling up your dragon is exciting also. content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												Honestly, I don't see what people are complaining about. You can easily just set your controls to whatever you want to make it easier for you. Anyways, this is a GREAT game! If I could, I would put this game in the featured items tab, because that's where it deserves to be. It has a great storyline to follow, a very simple and descriptive tutorial (people just complain because they don't listen to what it says when you start), a great, simple forging (item crafting) method, and last but not least, great designs for items, dragons, titans, etc.!

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 1, 2014
												The concept would be good, but the game has a lot of flaws. And by that, I mean, a LOT.First of all, let's begin with the tutorial. It's one of the worst training levels I've ever seen. You will also get bored of it really quickly.Then, I'd like to get into the controls: it's sometimes unclear, and some of the moves have two or more alternative functions aswell, meaning, that we may perform a specific attack without intention. Also, it's a mouse-cursor-following control, which is perfectly fine for games such as Diablo, Space Hack, Magicka or Path of Exile. For this game, I'd be more happy, if I got keyboard-controlling option.The other thing is the characters/abilities. Basically, we have 3 dragons to select (you have to buy the others by real money, but I'll tell more about it later), that has only 2-2 abilities. Then, we have a selectable item, which will provide us 2 more. For a game like this, it feels too few. I know, Awesomenauts also has 2-2 abilities for the characters, but it is still much more fun, and it doesn't feel like if it would need more. Also, as I said before, because of the controls, we may activate an ability by accident.The difficulty: (I'm going to talk about the botmatches) Well, the tutorial isn't really helpful, and the bots can♥♥♥♥♥♥you very quickly, and then win the moba gamemode. To compare with another game, Dota 2 is also hard, but it doesn't feel that bad.The gameplay: It feels empty and blank. You will get bored in really short time.The largest fatal flaw: One thing, that the game is pay to win. But it really got carried away with it. This is not just "Pay to Win", but "Pay to Do Everything" or "Pay to Breathe". I mean, that you have to buy characters/items for real-money, if you just want to finish a single "quest". And the reward just doesn't worth it. You will feel, that you just wasted your time (and money). If it's "F2P", then players shouldn't be limited down this much. Maybe if we would pay for some exclusive things/quests, I'd say, "OK, let it be, I will still have fun with the rest of the game", but this is like a cruel joke. If you handycap the F2P players that much, then make the game "Pay to Play" each month, and much less players will be♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off. Summa summarum: Dragons and Titans is a huge disappointment. It is a pity, because it COULD have the potential to be a great game. Unfortunately, they didn't make it.

												wow so many negative reviews about things that are totally pointless."hurrdurr its pay2win""its clunky controls""the tutorial is crap"no, and no.This is a MOBA. The tutorial takes about 20 minutes, this gets you enough ingame currency to buy 3 random dragons and 3 random weapons. Each dragon has 2 abilities, and each weapon has 2 abilities, you can use any weapon with any dragon. You also get 2 spells to use on long cooldowns.With the standard controls you hold Right click to move, and leftclick to attack with your primary ability. You can use Q W for your dragon abilities, E R for your weapon, and D F for your extra spells.If you pay, you can get things earlier than others, stronger dragons, upgrades, etc, but you can earn these through playtime anyway. The only thing that is pay2win is potions, that are only available for the single player campaign anyway.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												I loved the game at first, but the more I play it the more it irritates me.  At the lower levels, you can spend a few hours here and there having a blast, learning how to play and what dragon and weapon combination you can do the most damage with.  Unfortunately, leveling up too soon slows to a near halt, and you begin to realize just how unbalanced some of the types of attacks are.  An "update" early in 2014 added an auto-lock aim and the ability to strafe.  Add that to certain overly powerful attacks from certain dragons and you have inescapable death.  Seriously.  That's not an exaggeration.  It's impossible to avoid the attacks.  This kills the fun and often causes me to rage quit.  However, all that aside, I always end up going back to the game and trying again, with the (possibly foolish) hope that at some point perhaps I'll figure out how to defeat this foe, or the more likely hope that I'll get to play a few matches in which those particular attacks don't appear before I face them, die, and repeat the process.Recommend w/ caveat:  If the devs fix the balance issues, I would absolutely, enthusiastically recommend this game.  As is, I recommend it only if you want to spend the money to buy the over-powerful dragons so that you can have the cheap thrill of hollow victories.  Or if you actually don't mind the occasional futile death match.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												A fantastic game, that genuinely has been given unfairly bad reviews.The game is genuinely a unique ride, from start to finish. I've clocked in my fair share of Draconic combat, and thus far, I've genuinely enjoyed myself. There are most certainly aspects of it that are less than enjoyable, such as certain dragons feeling unstoppable, but in truth, every dragon can be beaten, but it's a matter of how well you play your own Dragon, and work with your teammates.For a free title, the game has quite a massive selection of unique Dragons and weapons to choose from, though they are unlocked via random bundle packs that are purchased via in-game currency, called Gems. 3 dragons per hatching pack, 3 weapons per weapon pack. It certainly adds an air of eagerness to earn more Gems to try and unlock more dragons, as well as trying to get lucky to obtain a weapon you may have your eye on. The controls take a short bit of getting used to, but once you're used to them, they're surprisingly smooth, and let you maneuver your way through the skys fluently, while breathing various elements at your enemies, to deter them, as well as throwing out interesting techniques, unique to each dragon.Is this game perfect? Definitely not. Is this game fun? Most certainly. Is it worth the asking price of 0 dollars? It got me to buy a founder pack, so hell yes it is. It frankly is a game worth trying, before passing judgement, and I don't regret any of the time I've spent in it so far.

												Loved it for about three hours since it's babies first moba. Everyone is equally awful at this game unless they were some of the blessed few who purchased all the content and stats before the new grind everything mentality.The key issue is essentially matchmaking issues. Bronze dragon matches are fine, everyone is a bronze, once you get to gold, you immediately get shafted by fighting a full plat opposing team.Getting new dragons is a painstaking process, leveling existing dragons is an impossible process.There are several ways to improve your statistics, gain ranks through battle, purchase dragon eggs which can randomly increment your favored dragon if you get multiples(Same with weapons), and grind from bronze-plat through battle. The only thing worth doing is the first two as the third will send you skyrocketing to fight the most korean people on the server.With randomized upgrades, matchmaking, and gameplay types, it's just fun enough to download for a few hours, but not fun enough to create lasting appeal.Also the dragon balance is♥♥♥♥♥♥and the developers have no way of interpreting feedback.So no developers, no community, bad balance, and horrible amounts of grind. I'll head back to dota, thanks.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												When it comes to recommending this game, I would have to say I am more indifferent than yes or no.  I'm just saying yes because to me it can keep one's attention and, all-and-all it is not a bad game, though it has its as flaws, like any other game.I'm not going to give a brief overview of the game, you want to find more official, better detailed ones, because I would probably miss a few important things, I'm just going to tell about my experiences and general opinion of the game.So it has good art, the dragons and weapons are beautifully designed and look great.  The environment looks really good, for me I am not really picky about general looks, but this game has got it down.  The biggest flaw is that it can become tedious and often times boring relatively quickly.  In order to get more dragons, weapons and runes, you must have crystals, the in-game currency.  In singleplayer you get roughly 50-70 crystals a match and for multiplayer and pvp a little more, I can't really say I play singleplayer more then anything.  So let us say I played ten singleplayer matches and got a total of at least 500, at most 700, not bad, but dragons and weapons require a very large amount of crystals to purchase.  Runes are only 150 per pack so that is fine with me, but a 3 pack of weapons is 2500 crystals and a 3 pack of dragons is 5000.  So let us say I am very unlucky and I get 50 crystals per match, I would have to play 100 matches to get a pack, and each match takes about 10-15 minutes, which is quick, but that would take at least 1000 minutes or 16.6 hours.  That is a lot of time.  It used to be you could just buy a dragon or weapon for money, but they got rid of that and made one thing called a titan pack.  You pay 20 dollars and you get one of each tier one dragons, one of each weapons, all the avatar skins, all the dragon skins, Acts 2-4 are now playable (yes, you must pay money to play the story line), all of your rewards are quadrupled for a year, and you will get all new content(like a new dragons or weapons) for a year.  I gotta say, that is actually extremely good.  Before they did this if I wanted to buy all the dragons, weapons, and such it would be more than that, so to me that is an improvement, though now it you only wanted one dragon, you have to pay the whole 20 dollars instead of 3.99 so it can be a double-edged sword of some sort.  Gameplay is good, but it gets very boring, the storyline is okay, but it is more about the multiplayer function.Going into the multiplayer function, I have only played multiplayer matches three times, but in those three times, the teams seemed to be a little lopsided.  But since you really can't have an overpowered dragon, you can increase certain things, but you can still be defeated easily if facing multiple enemies, so it depends on the players and their teamwork, and how well they use their skills too.So in conclusion,- dragons and weapons take a large amount of time to get- multiplayer matches can be lopsided- becomes tedious and boring quickly- you must pay money to play acts 2,3 and 4- you have to buy everything if you only wanted one thing, you must pay $20 if you only wanted to spend $3.99but,- the designs are great- singleplayer is always fun, at least to me- matches are quick- you get free dragons from the acts, all three tiers of a certain dragon, though you need to have certain dragons and weapons to fulfill requirements- you spend money once and you basically get everythingAll-in-all, if you are a casual gamer, this would be a good game, you can put time and effort into it, and you only have to make one purchase and that is it.  I apologize if I left something out, these were the things that I noticed in the game.If I were to give it a rating out of 10, 10 being the best: 6/10

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 24, 2016
												Curretly I do kind of like this game, but it has a huge amout of problems, specifically to do with the balenceing.Now the game and each of its' maps are and always has been ruled by a select few dragon and weapon combinations that have the highest DPS and pretty much beat any other dragon/weapon in the game, as you can no doubt guess, this plays hell with the game balence, as if you meet one of these wonder combinations on a map it's suited to, then you've pretty much lost before the battle's begun. Wait you cry, what about support and other roles? I'm sorry to dissapoint you, but appart from 1 or 2 healing dragons and weapons which are hardly ever picked anyway, this game is deicded purely on who can dish out the most damage in the shortest amount of time, there's hardy any skill involved when facing an opposing dragon, just simply who is the highest level and who has the highest DPS build.Now the matchmaker, if you could call it that, is also unbalenced. Unlike in most other MOBA's, there's no pregame lobby where everyone selects their dragon and weapon, no, instead you select the dragon, weapon and spells [pretty much the only spells anyone uses are the healing spell and the base teleport] you want before you jump into the game and the matchmaker throws a bunch of random people together, which combined with the fact that there can be multiple coppies of the same dragon/weapon on either team and the imbalenced combinations I mentioned above means that the game is pretty much decided before it even starts, which is very bad game design.Now as I said above multiple maps with one map being in rotation at a time, the map to be put into rotation is selected by the comunity via an in-game poll. So, four very different maps, sounds extensive for a MOBA right?  However practically no one votees for the standard MOBA map called Towers And Titans and Nether gates hardly ever shows up in the map poll. So there are pretty much only two modes, Balistae ally which is pretty much a single corridor where three high damage balistae bolts are shot from each side every couple of minutes. The other most played mode is Chaos unleashed, wherein you collect gold to summon Chaos who helps you detroy some structures. Having only one map in rotation and knowing which map is in rotation creates some serious balence issues, people can simply pick one of the afformentioned wonder combinations that is suited to that specific map.And know we get on to the Pay to Win aspect of the game. Now the game isn't pay to win as such, practically everything can be unlocked by playing for free, unfortunatly the vast majority of the very best stuff is placed at such a high amount of RNG and luck that it is just not practical to get them as a free to play player, so to get them, a little bit of money is called for.

I always like a game that lets you have a free play mode, multiplayer mode, or a Story line.~Cool dragons, each with it's own legend.~Tips for each dragon, which make it easier to fight if you take the time to read them.~Cool weapons to go with the dragons, also with they're own legends.~Challenging gameplay across all modes, but it's still not hard to complete~In game purchases. Most of which are not nessesary, but they give you a boost.Cons:~The map for forging weapons is a little to extensive and it costs an unreasonable amount of materials to upgrade anything. It also takes forever to find the resources in game, so you may have to buy them.~It takes forever just to get enough gems to get any new weapons or dragons ~You absolutly HAVE to buy new avatars with real money, not gems. And one thing I found particularly funny is one of the weapons:Unity Mark: The Engine of MagicThe pros definently out weigh the cons, and this game makes a great MMORPG or just an RPG if you don't want to play PvP or Co-op.EDIT: I just found out its called a MOBA. *Has major DUH! moment*

												I've played this game many times over the course of a few years. And I spend more than imagined time playing this game. It's addicting, amazing, and beautiful. The dragon types and kinds are vast and there seems to be no end in sight. Not only that but the skins for certain dragons are rare and a sight to behold. So many dragons to choose from you have to play more than once to familiarize yourself with them. I've bought the Titan Pass twice, missing one year entirely, (Life happens to everyone.) and I will continue to renew that subscription every year. Worth it for the amount of hours I've poured into this game.For anyone who loves dragons, flying, or fighting in general this is the game for you.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 17, 2015
												While I don't regularly play this game as much as I did before, I still enjoy Dragons and Titans. Its gameplay is simplistic, and pretty much everything is well-designed, both in mechanics and art/figures. If you are feeling bored and trigger-happy, then this game might be good for you.However, the gameplay doesn't involve much strategy. When you pick a game mode you just do a specific attack/defense pattern, and hope for the best. Secondly, the matchmaking system can be a nightmare very often. It just picks five random players for a team, so you frequently see copies of dragons on the same team. Or another case is when the opposing team has several powerful dragons, then your team is screwed. Thirdly, too many of the features require actual cash to be unlocked, like Acts and specific dragons or weapons.Overall, this is a nice game, but it's not worth investing a lot of money in it. Dragons and Titans is only a casual game, albeit a beautiful one.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 22, 2014
												When it comes to recommending this game, I would have to say I am more indifferent than yes or no.  I'm just saying yes because to me it can keep one's attention and, all-and-all it is not a bad game, though it has its as flaws, like any other game.I'm not going to give a brief overview of the game, you want to find more official, better detailed ones, because I would probably miss a few important things, I'm just going to tell about my experiences and general opinion of the game.So it has good art, the dragons and weapons are beautifully designed and look great.  The environment looks really good, for me I am not really picky about general looks, but this game has got it down.  The biggest flaw is that it can become tedious and often times boring relatively quickly.  In order to get more dragons, weapons and runes, you must have crystals, the in-game currency.  In singleplayer you get roughly 50-70 crystals a match and for multiplayer and pvp a little more, I can't really say I play singleplayer more then anything.  So let us say I played ten singleplayer matches and got a total of at least 500, at most 700, not bad, but dragons and weapons require a very large amount of crystals to purchase.  Runes are only 150 per pack so that is fine with me, but a 3 pack of weapons is 2500 crystals and a 3 pack of dragons is 5000.  So let us say I am very unlucky and I get 50 crystals per match, I would have to play 100 matches to get a pack, and each match takes about 10-15 minutes, which is quick, but that would take at least 1000 minutes or 16.6 hours.  That is a lot of time.  It used to be you could just buy a dragon or weapon for money, but they got rid of that and made one thing called a titan pack.  You pay 20 dollars and you get one of each tier one dragons, one of each weapons, all the avatar skins, all the dragon skins, Acts 2-4 are now playable (yes, you must pay money to play the story line), all of your rewards are quadrupled for a year, and you will get all new content(like a new dragons or weapons) for a year.  I gotta say, that is actually extremely good.  Before they did this if I wanted to buy all the dragons, weapons, and such it would be more than that, so to me that is an improvement, though now it you only wanted one dragon, you have to pay the whole 20 dollars instead of 3.99 so it can be a double-edged sword of some sort.  Gameplay is good, but it gets very boring, the storyline is okay, but it is more about the multiplayer function.Going into the multiplayer function, I have only played multiplayer matches three times, but in those three times, the teams seemed to be a little lopsided.  But since you really can't have an overpowered dragon, you can increase certain things, but you can still be defeated easily if facing multiple enemies, so it depends on the players and their teamwork, and how well they use their skills too.So in conclusion,- dragons and weapons take a large amount of time to get- multiplayer matches can be lopsided- becomes tedious and boring quickly- you must pay money to play acts 2,3 and 4- you have to buy everything if you only wanted one thing, you must pay $20 if you only wanted to spend $3.99but,- the designs are great- singleplayer is always fun, at least to me- matches are quick- you get free dragons from the acts, all three tiers of a certain dragon, though you need to have certain dragons and weapons to fulfill requirements- you spend money once and you basically get everythingAll-in-all, if you are a casual gamer, this would be a good game, you can put time and effort into it, and you only have to make one purchase and that is it.  I apologize if I left something out, these were the things that I noticed in the game.If I were to give it a rating out of 10, 10 being the best: 6/10

Posted: November 12, 2015
												It might not be the best game out there in this particular genre but that doesn't mean this is pure♥♥♥♥♥♥either. I believe this is a good game for people new to MOBA gaming. It could act as a gateway for casuals to turn into hard core players. I, for one, enjoy this game a lot. I haven't played much multiplayer (I'm hoping to get to that) but in single player, the rounds are pretty short (Chaos Unleashed takes about 20 minutes I believe or somewhat off). Others may find that a negative aspect of the game but for people like me who play this at school, I don't have an hour or more of uninterrupted school time to play just one match. I wouldn't have wanted to play an hour much either if I had the time. The only major issue is that I feel like the game is pushing you to buy a Titan's Pass. You can only do Act 1 (a dissapointment since I wanted to finish the rest to get all the cool dragons they offered). After each match, you gain a painstakenly small amount of Runes which is fustrating because Dragon eggs are 5,000 and weapons are 2,500. About the eggs and weapons, you can only buy cases of three and have to rely on pure chance and luck to get that weapon/dragon you're looking for after countless hours spent just saving enough to get them in the first place. That problem just pushes you EVEN FURTHER to get a Titan's Pass. If only they made it a little bit more easier to earn stuff then I'd be content. The next issue I'd like to address about this game is the Options menu. It's not very advanced. (It's an improvement from the Kong website.) You can't adjust the loudness of the sounds and music. Either you keep it or disable it all together.

												As a fan of Dota 2, I was surprised to find how enjoyable I found the more casual Dragons and Titans. The games are pretty short, and the different dragons&weapons seem nice and different, and the game even has a pretty good option for buying every single dragon and weapon in the Titan Pass. I'll probably buy it later, although I'm still considering it. What I've looked of the global chat the community is terrible as always in MOBAs, but the ugliness hasn't reared its ugly head in the matches themselves yet, thankfully.The game isn't very deep, but it's fun. Perhaps at later points the nastier sides of the game, such as the grindy nature of upgrades, start to show, but haven't seen any major problems rising from it yet - I've managed to crush people 30+ ranks above me in the matches despite their probably better rune-pages. (Dragonkin is crazy good dragon, if you get it as one of the three free dragons you randomly get at the start, it's Call of the Kine ability is ridiculously good. It helps a lot when you can summon additional DPS and bodies to fights early on, and they are still good later on, two summons meaning that you pretty much win most 1v1 fights since they are more like 3v1 fights)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 1, 2015
												I give this game a 7/10.As far as MOBAs go, Dragons and Titans is a boiled-down MOBA that is GREAT for beginners. I have a friend who never plays them, and she actually gave DaT a try and loves it. There are no items to deal with in the game, and experience is granted by killing enemies and collecting gold. Potions that drop on the map restore your health, and there are numerous spells you can use in-game (similar to other MOBAs). There are various ways to play and the map cycles every half hour. There's even a single-player campaign to unlock new dragons, and you can upgrade dragons and weapons over time. Dragons are also really well-designed and are really cool. I have a total of five, right now due to weekly rewards and the single-player campaign, not to mention the three you get for free for playing through the tutorial stages. The downside? It is a boiled-down MOBA. Experienced MOBA players might find the game a bit dull, overall (especially if you're coming from DOTA). I played LoL for a while, and I currently play SMITE, but Dragons and Titans is stilll a fun game to play with friends. It just doesn't take nearly as much skill, in comparison. Another downside is that much of the content is locked behind what they are calling the Titan Pass, a $20 pass that gives you access to a bunch of extra stuff (like the other three single-player campaigns). Granted, if you're THAT into the game that you're willing to pay that's great. But I feel it is a bit much for someone who only plays casually. Lastly, queue times for PVP games can be rather long due to a small population of players. I had a PVP queue last at least 5 minutes a few days ago, for example (I've never waited more than a minute and a half in SMITE). Overall, Dragons and Titans is a great MOBA for beginners, and shouldn't be counted out just because it started out browser-based, or because of the boiled-down features. Give it a shot - the darned thing is free. If you don't like it, uninstall. If you do, though, keep playing and I hope to see you in the sky someday.
